lenders.name: Oscar

lenders.name: Mike
lenders.loan_because: I like the idea of giving a business loan and not a handout.

lenders.name: Rich K
lenders.loan_because: I like to see  people get a break and become successful in their lives.
lenders.occupational_info: Consult on food safety  and regulatory matters for food companies.

lenders.name: Darrel
lenders.loan_because: I am an atheist, secular humanist and author of The God Virus: How Religion Infects Our Lives and Culture (IPC Press, 2009).  I have been a member of Kiva for over two years and have found this to be a superb way to help people in a way that ensures the money is used wisely.  I keep about $450 in circulation at any given time.  That may sound like a lot, but it really isn't since I have loaned every dollar of that money many times.  I decided that instead of just giving money to some charity and never seeing any results, I would put some of the money I normally give into Kiva.  I have only had two $25 loans default in over two years and 60 or 70 loans (maybe more).  Thanks to the Kiva staff for this great organization.  I tell people about it at every opportunity.
lenders.occupational_info: Author, organizational psychologist.

lenders.name: pura vida
lenders.loan_because: a little voice told us to.
lenders.occupational_info: We live in Minneapolis where we work in Construction and sales. We are involved in Nicaragua and have lived in Thailand. We firmly believe luck and chance have given us the opportunity to learn from other people and hopefully to help in some small way.

lenders.name: Adam
lenders.loan_because: This is a great idea!
lenders.occupational_info: I defend people in court when the government accuses them of crimes.

lenders.name: Steve
lenders.loan_because: I hope to help people achieve their greatest potential.
lenders.occupational_info: As a Certified Public Accountant (CPA) I used to help people prepare their accounting records and reports, and I  helped them to prepare their government tax reports.  I am now retired.

lenders.name: Herve
lenders.loan_because: I want people to share happiness, live in peace, and be free from any form of oppression.

lenders.name: Daniel
lenders.loan_because: I am.

lenders.name: Andrea

lenders.occupational_info: I work in a very creative place with lots of artists.

lenders.name: TRACY
lenders.loan_because: having been born in Kenya it gives me great pleasure to help empower woman to become economically independent in a country where i grew up
lenders.occupational_info: I am a self employed hairdresser and nutritionist. It gives me great pleasure when i get results from both my hairsyling and nutritional data. I love what i do.

lenders.name: Kate
lenders.loan_because: this is such an awesome opportunity to help people live their dreams of financial independence.
lenders.occupational_info: I help people work safely, with respect for each other and their environment.

I find it a very interesting way of funding people to help themselves.

I think Microlending has potential.

lenders.name: World of Neighbors
lenders.loan_because: 1 John 3:17-18:  How does God's love abide in anyone who has the world's goods and sees a brother or sister in need and yet refuses help?  Little children, let us love, not in word or speech, but in truth and action.
lenders.occupational_info: Envisioning a world without poverty and injustice, our small group works faithfully to bring this world into being by educating and empowering ourselves and others.  We live by the Great Commandment to love our neighbors as ourselves.

lenders.name: William
lenders.loan_because: It is great to help someone help themselves.

lenders.name: Janne
lenders.loan_because: I believe conscious capitalism combines the best of free markets and philanthropy.

lenders.name: Madolyn
lenders.loan_because: it's fun to be part of this collective process.

lenders.name: Frank

lenders.name: Bob
lenders.loan_because: I want to know that I have helped someone else to move ahead!

lenders.name: Jon
lenders.loan_because: I care (and have spent time in the developing world and appreciate that micro-credit really makes a difference.)
lenders.occupational_info: I build professional websites and help market them so that they get found by the "right" people via the Internet. I also speak and do workshops on Internet marketing and "Winning with Ease: Life Lessons Learned from Golf"

lenders.name: David

lenders.occupational_info: Former, now retired, international businessman. Primary area was consumer electronics.

lenders.name: s & t

lenders.name: Sami Swan

lenders.occupational_info: I'm a freelance writer and editor, collage artist, and independent advocate for the elderly.  My latest project is PROMPTLY WRITTEN; check it out at the url listed in the website space below:

lenders.name: shelli
lenders.occupational_info: I work in wastewater reclamation and reuse.  We use a process called activates sludge (microbiology) to help clean up the wastewater. Once the wastewater has completed the process it is then used at golf courses and ponds. This is the reuse part of the process.

lenders.name: Mark & Silvia
lenders.loan_because: I first got interested in the Grammeen Bank about 15 years ago and I usually give to various charities.  This is much better as you are making a direct contribution to someones life!!
lenders.occupational_info: Silvia and I are raising our first child, Lia who is 1 month old.  We do have regular jobs in computers and real estate.  We are both from Canada but work in the US which has been very good to us.

lenders.name: Anthony
lenders.loan_because: I have claimed to be "too busy" to get involved in charity long enough! Kiva is an excellent place to start.
lenders.occupational_info: I engineer new materials that are used to advance communication technology, medicine, semiconductors etc.

lenders.name: Coleen
lenders.loan_because: I like to help women who are trying to create a successful business to support their families and improve their life experiences.
lenders.occupational_info: I help people solve their software issues.  I also have my own business creating handmade soap, bath & body products.

lenders.name: Dave
lenders.loan_because: Self sufficiency is the way to a successful life.
lenders.occupational_info: I operate two shelters for homeless families in California.

lenders.name: Tom
lenders.loan_because: Effort is rewarded

lenders.name: Gordon and Cathy
lenders.loan_because: We all should share what we have.  We are neighbors.
lenders.occupational_info: We give our time and energy and support to the non-profit organization called Redwood Parks Association who provide education and services to visitors on California's north coast.

lenders.name: Heather
lenders.loan_because: Together we can make a difference.

lenders.occupational_info: I lecture mathematics in college.

lenders.occupational_info: Social Enterprise and Micro-Lending give normal people the ability to help change the world.

lenders.name: Cheryl
lenders.loan_because: It's wonderful that Kiva provides a way for me to offer a hand  to help people that are working to improve their lives and the lives of others.
lenders.occupational_info: I work as a marketing account manager for an insurance company. Basically, I keep our customers happy by coordinating all of their communications with our different internal departments.

lenders.name: Angela and her family!
lenders.loan_because: I've seen micro-credit touch lives! I first learned about the Grammeen Bank 5 years ago when I worked with an organization called, Reach The Children.  I worked with an AIDS Prevention program and saw how micro-finance along with other programs can help make a large difference.
lenders.occupational_info: I started a similar company called, "Given Tree".  We certify NGO's and make sure they're up to standard before posting projects for people to give to.  We do not do micro-loans.  We do other essential projects that are so badly needed; well building, schools, AIDS/HIV Prevention, etc.

lenders.loan_because: We musn´t give up on poverty and we can help people to have a good life in their own countries .This is an exelent way to do it .High five to all of us who helped to raise the needed money to help this particular person .

Cualquier persona que tenga buenas ideas empresarias deberia de poder realizar sus metas.  El no tener finanzas seminales no es razon para no poder lograr sus suenos de ser empresario.

lenders.occupational_info: I work for a company that sells affordable clothing and home goods, and I help them plan for new stores.

lenders.loan_because: I like to help others.

lenders.name: T K S N M Sherry

lenders.name: Donna
lenders.loan_because: It's a mitzvah.  If we learn about a hard-working person who needs a little help to become independent and rise out of poverty, shouldn't we reach out to that person?  This is a great way to do it, to make a difference, one person at a time.
lenders.occupational_info: I consult radio stations and train future broadcasters and journalists.  I also teach media history, ethics, and comparative religions. And, I write articles for a number of magazines and newspapers.  In my spare time, I volunteer as a tutor.

lenders.name: Mehdi
lenders.loan_because: The purpose of living is to make a living that worth living. I hope we could make many lives worth living by these small loans. MicroCredit is scientifically proved to be one of the few constructive and efficient ways to end/alleviate poverty around the world with almost no rival. It is easy, direct and with negligible waste of resources. Interestingly, On long run it helps both rich and poor.

lenders.name: Cary

The spirit of the sovereign Lord is upon me, because the Lord has chosen me. He has commissioned me to encourage the poor, to help the brokenhearted, to decree the release of captives, and the freeing of prisoners
Isaiah 61:1

...and I want to follow His footsteps.

lenders.name: Payam
lenders.loan_because: I believe in connecting individuals to one another throughout the world. Only in this way will we achieve the ultimate goal of eradicating poverty from the earth.
lenders.occupational_info: I will receive my Masters in Public Health this Spring, and begin my medical education at Case Western University in the fall.

lenders.name: GERTRUDES
lenders.loan_because: i want to sustain the credit needs of at least the 50 women-enterpreneurs of NORFIL/NWRMC for them to have continuous source of income and  livelihood, thereby improve the quality of their lives.
lenders.occupational_info: I am the Program Manager of a microfinance operation - the NORFIL Women Resource for Micro Credit in the Philippines.

lenders.name: Jan
lenders.loan_because: We're all on Earth together.

lenders.loan_because: I believe in the power of individuals to make a difference in the world through small, well thought actions.

lenders.occupational_info: I'm a student and thus, studying is my work

lenders.loan_because: Nicholas Kristof can be very persuasive.

lenders.name: Lauren
lenders.loan_because: I believe in a free market economy.  I think that these types of loans are a good way to encourage individual responsibility and free(er) markets.

lenders.name: Sharnell
lenders.loan_because: Helping others to help themselves, their families, their friends, their communities and their local economy to break the cycle of poverty to improve lives and provide opportunities.
lenders.occupational_info: I help people clarify their life goals, and then guide and manipulate their finances to achieve those goals.

lenders.name: Horace Mungin
lenders.loan_because: There is such a great disparity between the well-to-do and the poor of this planet. This should not be - we travel through the universe together on the same ball we call earth.
lenders.occupational_info: I am a writer of stories that are about what I see - the good and the bad. I write about what is hopeful and what should be and can be viewed and aspired too.

lenders.name: David
lenders.loan_because: My family is here because someone's investment in their dreams. I feel that any investment in someone's dreams is a positive. We need to help each other as a society and make poverty a thing of the past.
lenders.occupational_info: Im a humanitarian at heart and a filmmaker who enjoys bring smiles to people's faces.

lenders.name: Adam
lenders.loan_because: we're all neighbours

lenders.name: Richard
lenders.loan_because: I can.  I had no idea there was the means to help individuals provide capital where it's needed so many places around the world.  I've been the beneficiary of timely loans. My self respect remained intact and long after a gift would have been exhausted, the loan was still paying dividends.
lenders.occupational_info: After a career in the theater and "alternative energy," I'm back on the farm helping to keep bees and raise sheep and timber.  I'm a little creaky in the joints now, but I still love what I do.

lenders.name: Nicholas
lenders.loan_because: i have been fortunate, and wish to share my good fortune.
lenders.occupational_info: i design bars and restaurants.

lenders.name: Kim
lenders.loan_because: We are all in this world together, and we must help each other, whenever and however possible.
lenders.occupational_info: International political, business and development consulting, and business law.

lenders.name: Dan
lenders.loan_because: I read Nicholas Kristof's column in The New York Times and I'm checking the Web site out. I can spare $25 bucks now and then.
lenders.occupational_info: I'm a college student but also an aspiring journalist and world travler.

lenders.name: Timothy
lenders.loan_because: I am eager to engage, reach out to and learn from people with different life experiences from my own.
lenders.occupational_info: I build instruments for rocket research in the upper earth atmosphere.  We are curious about how the sun's energy filters down to us and about how the earth's atmospheric 'system' works.

lenders.name: Guido
lenders.loan_because:
For many years I have been involved with development work through   international organizations. I travel to more than 25 countries in the world and have been in many of the poorest areas (including Bangladesh, the north east of Brazil, Bolivia, Haiti, Indonesia, Philippines...). Many loans and grants  do not produce the "results on the ground" that they project; actually more often than not they don't!  

More than ten years ago I started my own development work by sponsoring children in rural villages around the globe. Through Plan USA my wife and me now keep contact with more than a dozen kids which we adopted as "our foster kids". 

Work on my own family history, especially in the last few years, brought back cherished memories about our family tradition of entrepreneurship.  From grandfather's time in the early 1900s, to my dad's time in the second half of the 20th century, till now, my family has been strong promoters of entrepreneurship. 

It is in that tradition that I started two years ago to lend to KIVA entrepreneurs. I like to help people who take initiative, who want to establish or grow a small business; I favor expanding trade and  markets for  products made by poor people.

Last but not least, I like to be "a banker", assemble a portfolio of loans that is well balanced, regionally as well as by sector, and test my  skills in picking entrepreneurs that will make a profit, increase their income, and have no problems repaying their loan. I strongly belief that making loans to entrepreneurs in developing countries is one of the greatest contributions one can make.
lenders.occupational_info: I  follow daily the developments in financial markets and study the rapid growth and evolution of micro-finance and social enterprises; I am keenly interested in the developments in alternative medicine and health care. My interest in family history and in  the use of DNA to enhance findings in genealogy i.e genetic genealogy, have led me to rediscover a valuable family tradition of entrepreneurship, taking risks, dreaming the impossible, and helping others to achieve their goals.

lenders.name: Adam
lenders.loan_because: help and hope are essential.

lenders.name: Casey
lenders.loan_because: it is an effective way to tangibly help someone get on her feet.
lenders.occupational_info: I teach history to kids, aged 16-18, in a public high school.

lenders.name: Gunilla
lenders.loan_because: It makes sense.

lenders.name: Jeffrey & Barbara
lenders.loan_because: It's a little something we can do to add a bit of stability to this chaotic world.
lenders.occupational_info: We sell antiques on eBay.  Jeff used to be a computer programmer and Barb is an artist.  For a time, both of us cooked together for a local school.

lenders.name: Marie
lenders.loan_because: I am blessed to have enough money to loan others who are trying their hardest to build good lives for themselves and their families.
lenders.occupational_info: I am a retired public librarian working in an Egyptology library in Luxor, Egypt, 6 months a year.

lenders.name: Thomas
lenders.loan_because: I recently moved back from Afghanistan where I had to opportunity to see the tremendously positive potential of microlending first hand. I first learned of Kiva in Kabul and am now totally addicted.
lenders.occupational_info: I work on Sen. Barack Obama's presidential campaign.

lenders.name: Carol
lenders.occupational_info: I help people resolve disputes and conflict through conversation.

lenders.name: Nazly
lenders.loan_because: I believe that some of money I have earned actually belong to others.
lenders.occupational_info: I am helping multi national companies restructure their investments.

lenders.name: East Coast Artisans
lenders.loan_because: As craftsmen/artists ourselves we know how much can be done with just a small amount of money.  Once a person purchases basic equipment and supplies (often for much less than $1000), they are in business and can begin to make a profit.
lenders.occupational_info: Lee Skalkos and Judy Standerford are both American craftsmen.  Lee is a silversmith and Judy is a weaver.  In 2006 they took on the job of publishing the East Coast Artisan, a trade magazine for working artists and craftsmen. We publish contact information about shows and events in the Northeast.  We also include business tips, exhibitor submitted show reviews, profiles of artists, and other information of interest to craftsmen/artists.

lenders.name: Stuart
lenders.loan_because: We are quickly becoming a global community and we need to think of people-in-need in other countries as our neighbors. This opportunity gives hard-working people a chance to build a business in an honorable way.

lenders.name: Kelley, Mike & Liam
lenders.loan_because: We want to help.

lenders.name: Judith
lenders.loan_because: I have been helped by others in my life in the same way. I believe others will do well if they have an opportunity.
lenders.occupational_info: Professor and activist.

lenders.name: Brian
lenders.loan_because: This is an opportunity to help people help themselves.
lenders.occupational_info: I work with political parties to compete in democracies around the world.

lenders.name: James
lenders.loan_because: I like to see people helping themselves.
lenders.occupational_info: I help big companies use computers and technology to do their business better.

lenders.name: Annette Laing
lenders.loan_because: We all owe each other a helping hand. As a British immigrant to America, I wouldn't be where I am today without others' investment of time and money.  I mostly invest in Peru as a big 'thank you' to Peruvians for a wonderful week I spent in Lima, and in Costa Rica, where my son loved his time learning Spanish at CPI. :-)
lenders.occupational_info: After many years as a university history professor, I am now the author of The Snipesville Chronicles, a MG/YA series of time-travel novels. I also create and perform non-boring history programs for kids in schools, libraries, and other venues. Check out my web site!

lenders.name: Steve
lenders.loan_because: I love the idea that people with small amounts of capital can help people who need small amounts of capital.
lenders.occupational_info: I am a computer programmer and web site manager in a company that provides staffing and placement services to other businesses.

lenders.name: Joe
lenders.loan_because: I tell my students to seize opportunities to make the world better, and so I must do the same
lenders.occupational_info: I teach college students in the United States to be good citizens of their campus, community, country, and planet.

lenders.name: James
lenders.loan_because: What better way to spend a few dollars and help a small business establish itself and provide employment.
lenders.occupational_info: Retired

lenders.name: Mark and Janet
lenders.occupational_info: Mark is a doctor and Janet is the lead singer for a children's band.

lenders.name: Carmen
lenders.loan_because: I really like this program.    I think a small contribution on my end means a lot to people who need it.

lenders.name: Jack
lenders.loan_because: I can.  It's a short life; one may as well be useful to others.
lenders.occupational_info: We help people prepare for standardized tests like the SAT.

lenders.name: D. Family
lenders.loan_because: We want to make a meaningful impact on helping others help themselves.

lenders.name: Jack
lenders.loan_because: I want to help.

lenders.name: Sandra
lenders.loan_because: "True and undefiled religion is meeting the widow and the orphan in their need."
lenders.occupational_info: I am an author and a graduate-school professor. I write both non-fiction and fiction.

lenders.name: Rich
lenders.loan_because: I can help.  Others have helped me in the past and now I can do the same.
lenders.occupational_info: I work in the U.S. Embassy in Cotonou, benin.

lenders.name: Thomas
lenders.loan_because: I am excited to see individuals taking charge and trying to grow a business through hard work and community involvement.
lenders.occupational_info: I help business people and technical people involved in the insurance industry communicate and understand each other's needs.

lenders.name: Drew
lenders.loan_because: Nicholas Kristof told me to.
lenders.occupational_info: I study ocean science to understand how the Earth's climate works.  By the way - that picture is me, in a kiva!  Kivas are neat.

lenders.name: Jessica
lenders.loan_because: Running your own business builds self-esteem and provides the opportunity to help other people become self-supporting.
lenders.occupational_info: I teach yoga and also paint designs for greeting cards and gifts.

lenders.name: Sridhar
lenders.loan_because: I can.

lenders.name: Dennis
lenders.loan_because: I lend because I am skeptical of  my own country's trickle-down theories of financing projects for ordinary people.  Direct aid actually reaches the people who need it and will put it to use.
lenders.occupational_info: I was professor of history at a state university, fortunate to have had important parts of my career abroad.

lenders.name: Frank
lenders.occupational_info: teacher/higher.education/montreal

lenders.name: Jon
lenders.loan_because: He that hath pity upon the poor lendeth unto the LORD; and that which he hath given will he pay him again. Proverbs 19
lenders.occupational_info: I work with computers

lenders.name: Bonnie
lenders.loan_because: it's a small, simple way to make a big difference.
lenders.occupational_info: I write and edit articles for magazines and websites.

lenders.name: Deborah
lenders.loan_because: women can save the planet

lenders.name: Jann
lenders.loan_because: I am fortunate to have more than enough to sustain my lifestyle.  I believe that by helping others I make the world a better place for myself, my family & ultimately everyone.
lenders.occupational_info: I travel extensively and enjoy learning about other people and their cultures. I document our trips in photographs and enjoy sharing them with friends and family as a way to include them in my experiences.

lenders.name: Jim
lenders.loan_because: I have been very fortunate in life. I admire people who work to make their life better. I am happy that my meagre contributions can help a few of them.

lenders.name: Lance
lenders.loan_because: I feel it is important that the haves can enable the have-nots to also become haves.

lenders.name: Veronique Bure
lenders.loan_because: I beleive that with  work, especially for  for  women, allows the whole family to access safety,  better health and hopefully  health care  and  education
lenders.occupational_info: I work with babies,  young  children  and their family to help them fight their handicap

lenders.name: J & M
lenders.loan_because: We want to help moms and children.

lenders.name: Jonathan
lenders.loan_because: It gives me the opportunity to directly impact the lives of others. Other people have helped me during my business life, so I know first hand what can be accomplished with a little "help from our friends".

lenders.name: Terry
lenders.loan_because: I am able to and I have a strong belief in helping people to help themselves.

lenders.name: Deborah
lenders.loan_because: I loan because I can. The money that I have is more than I need to survive so if I can give what I have to someone who does not have enough then I can live knowing that I am contributing to the betterment of the world.

lenders.name: Fred
lenders.loan_because: I believe that micro-loans are a proven method of enabling individuals to improve their lives.
lenders.occupational_info: I am a retired navy medical department officer and also worked as a medical analyst.

lenders.name: Christine
lenders.loan_because: I want to pass along the help I got when I needed it.

lenders.name: Martin
lenders.loan_because: I think it's an efficient, worthwhile way to increase happiness on our planet.  My two children are of Peruvian and Bolivian lineage.

lenders.name: Carmen
lenders.loan_because: I believe more good can be done with micro-loans than by charity giving.
lenders.occupational_info: I have a micro farm (or large backyard) where I grow fruits, vegetables and flowers. Tengo una finquita muy chiquita donde cultivo frutas, vegetales y flores.

lenders.name: Pamela
lenders.loan_because: I believe that microloans are an enpowering method of philanthropy and powerful force for credit outside the capital markets.
lenders.occupational_info: I work for a reponsible international bank where philanthropy and volunteerism are an integral part of the culture.

lenders.name: Peggy
lenders.loan_because: it is a way to make a direct difference in someone's life.
lenders.occupational_info: I program a website for a nonprofit in the health field.

lenders.name: Bradley
lenders.loan_because: It's so easy to make a difference with just a small amount of money.

lenders.name: Siobhan
lenders.loan_because: I loan because it’s an opportunity to directly impact people living in extreme poverty throughout the world. There is so much destruction in the world. Kiva gives lenders a chance to build up instead of tearing down. I like to think of the effect that one loan can have beyond the borrower, on the individual’s family and community. Over the time that I’ve been investing through Kiva, I have decided to loan only to women. That is not because there aren’t men in need of money and with great ideas for businesses, but because I want to empower women. And because I have an interest in arts and crafting, I look for entrepreneurs who are doing such things as weaving, painting and ceramics. These business owners may be keeping certain art forms alive; I want to support their efforts.

lenders.name: The Hooper family
lenders.loan_because: Every investor is essentially looking for an investment with a great return. There is no better return on an investment...giving opportunities, changing lives, helping others help themselves.

lenders.name: Elizabeth
lenders.loan_because: What better investment is there than in ourselves.
lenders.occupational_info: I teach English and Theater classes and in my spare time (not grading) I read, write, paint, walk my dogs, hike, and make jewelry.

lenders.name: Alicia
lenders.loan_because: everyone should have the opportunity to pursue their dream.

lenders.name: Suzanne
lenders.loan_because: I want to make a difference to people like me - ordinary, hard-working, not rich.  Thanks so much for putting this program together!
lenders.occupational_info: I work for a high-end architect and I do working drawings for very expensive and beautiful homes using a computer.

lenders.name: Jane
lenders.loan_because: I think this is a wonderful way to develop connections throughout the world and to foster self-sufficiency for many people.
lenders.occupational_info: I teach English to college students. I also teach creative writing, poetry and fiction to graduate level writers.

lenders.name: Christopher
lenders.loan_because: Seems like a great way to assist those less fortunate.  Thanks to Mr. Kristof for letting all NYT readers know about this!
lenders.occupational_info: I am an attorney.

lenders.name: Daniel
lenders.loan_because: I can

lenders.name: joan
lenders.loan_because: Everyone deserves an opportunity to achieve their personal and professional goals. The idea that I could lend money to people who do not have access to US lending institutions seemed worthwhile & exciting.
lenders.occupational_info: I was a teacher of children with moderate to severe disabilities for 23 years. I am now working on a PhD in early childhood special education at Vanderbilt University.

lenders.name: Kevin
lenders.loan_because: the greatest gift I have ever received was the opportunity to achieve my potential in business.
lenders.occupational_info: I started as a clerk. I worked very hard for several years. Then I took the risk of going out on my own as a trader.

lenders.name: Susan
lenders.loan_because: This is a small thing I can do that will make a real difference to some people who are trying hard to improve their lives.
lenders.occupational_info: I talk with people to try and help them find healthy ways to live their lives

lenders.name: Vivian
lenders.loan_because: I sincerely believe that the best (most effective and efficient) way to make a positive difference in this world is to inspire and help others to help themselves.  Thanks to Kiva for giving us an avenue to do so.
lenders.occupational_info: Touching people's lives by spreading positive energy to others in practical ways.

lenders.name: marian
lenders.loan_because: i admire these hard working people who just need a little help.
lenders.occupational_info: we raise boer goats for market and for breeding stock on our 90 acre farm in the finger lakes region.

lenders.name: Jerru
lenders.loan_because: I am happy to demonstrate that citizens of the United States can get involved in the lives of the people of other countries, in ways that don't involve war or oil.
lenders.occupational_info: I study the space environments of Earth and Saturn, using data from NASA spacecraft.

lenders.name: Pamela & Roger
lenders.loan_because: Kiva makes it easy to do the right thing. What better way to lend a helping hand!

lenders.name: Miriam
lenders.occupational_info: I am an organic chemist working to make a molecule that fights cancer.

lenders.name: Robin  and Phil
lenders.loan_because: We believe in helping others get their businesses started or grow their businesses so they can be self-sufficient in supporting themselves and their families.
lenders.occupational_info: Business consulting

lenders.name: Daniel
lenders.occupational_info: I use mathematics to understand how ecosystems function and what the consequences of human actions might be for those systems.

lenders.name: Tim
lenders.loan_because: Dude, I'm trying to make some cash here and the feds are all uptight about what they call "loansharking."  Seriously, this is a good idea.  Instead of making a one-time donation you can get a business going and help sustain economies - or something like that.  Like teaching a man to fish instead of giving him a fish or loaning a woman money for a fish net, like I did.
lenders.occupational_info: I live in America and basically I work to support my Starbuck's habit.  I'm not really a caveman, that's just my silly American Joe sense of humor.  Well, I'm kinda like a caveman in that I really need a haircut right now and I am fascinated by fire.  Fire bad!

lenders.name: Jessica
lenders.loan_because: As a freelancer, and the daughter of immigrants I want to support people working to better themselves and their families.
lenders.occupational_info: I design logos, brochures and marketing material for companies

lenders.name: SUDDHADEB
lenders.loan_because: To start a company to providing software solution & development to various clients.
lenders.occupational_info: I work as a programmer,which i want to quit and develop a multi-utility software with lots of features.In one word my software could be termed as task-effective and cost-effective.Due to which business sectors will be able to cut down their software implementation cost.And for this I need $2000 to start.

lenders.name: Shirley & Jim
lenders.loan_because:
There is one world - Earth.
There is one race - the human race.
lenders.occupational_info:
Shirley runs computer systems for schools.
Jim is retired from the mobile telecom industry.

lenders.name: Scott
lenders.loan_because: I enjoy assisting people in other countries who are trying to better their lives and help their families.
lenders.occupational_info: Now mostly retired, I work part-time delivering cars for a car rental company and car dealerships in Michigan.

lenders.name: Charles
lenders.loan_because: I was very poor as a child but am blessed with a "job" that I consider to be a fun adventure, lobstering out of Nantuclet.
lenders.occupational_info:
I now own a 36 foot lobsterboat and go on a "boatride" three or four days a week for four months to haul my lobster traps and make the money I need for the whole year.
    Couldn't be better for a wharf rat like me!

lenders.name: Carol & Christine
lenders.loan_because: empowering women entreprenuers changes society for the better!

lenders.name: Maya
lenders.loan_because: Because of the N. Krostof's article in the NYT on 3/27/07. I can't save the world, but  Kiva allows me to make a small positive contribution to a few individual lives.
lenders.occupational_info: I work with international students at Columbia University. More than half are from developing countries and come to NY to study economics.

lenders.name: Benjamin
lenders.loan_because: I have money now that I'm no longer in the Peace Corps!
lenders.occupational_info: I help planes fly.

lenders.name: Edward
lenders.occupational_info: healthcare

lenders.name: Lara Ewing
lenders.loan_because: It makes a difference to the individuals and the communities receiving the loan.  It allows people to be self-sufficient.
lenders.occupational_info: I help leaders in companies work together more effectively.  This makes their companies prosper.

lenders.name: Janet
lenders.loan_because: It's the right thing to do. Having traveled a lot in developing countries, I understand that a little can go a long way.
lenders.occupational_info: I combine antique and contemporary textiles and other items such as old postcards to create decorative quilted items.

lenders.name: Kjellrun
lenders.loan_because: I can

lenders.name: Stephen
lenders.loan_because: I could say that it is the right thing to do, but I have always wanted to be an international banker like J. P. Morgan, and this is the closest that I am going to get! :-)
lenders.occupational_info: I teach History at Shantou University.

lenders.name: Betsy and family
lenders.loan_because: my children need to understand that their most valuable possession is not money or an object; it is opportunity.

lenders.name: JUDY&SIA
lenders.loan_because: We give so that others may live their lives to the fullest.

lenders.name: Helen
lenders.loan_because: It's the right thing to do.

lenders.name: Kerry & Jerry
lenders.loan_because: It's the right thing to do.  If you've ever watched the movie "Pay It Forward," you understand.
lenders.occupational_info: Jerry teaches underprivileged inner-city students, ages 11-14.  Kerry markets Southern Comfort.

lenders.name: Sigrid
lenders.loan_because: I am a great believer in helping others to succeed. This is a wonderful program.

lenders.name: Rachel
lenders.occupational_info: I work for myself, too. I write and edit articles, mostly about medicine.

lenders.name: Christine
lenders.loan_because: it gives me joy to share

lenders.name: Sukumar
lenders.loan_because: I like helping the poor people especially the children in need.
lenders.occupational_info: I'm committed to give excellent education, especially to the poor and orphans in South India.I may not shell out in millions but I can give my share to help someone in need.

lenders.name: Connie
lenders.loan_because: I loan because I have been blessed, and I want to share.
lenders.occupational_info: I am semi-retired. To me, that means that I am waiting, quietly, for my next challenge. I sold computer-related services in the corporate environment for 28 years.

lenders.name: Lani
lenders.loan_because: I hope it helps.
lenders.occupational_info: I manage all of the functioning for our department - make sure classes happen, people get paid, students fulfill all the requirements for graduation, etc.

lenders.name: Carolyn & Don
lenders.loan_because: We have had such wonderful, enjoyable, fulfilling lives.  We would like to share that with others.
lenders.occupational_info: My husband works in a high school with children 16 through 18.   I am a  homemaker and a retired teacher of children 6 through 9.  We have 7 grown children and 2 grandchildren.

lenders.name: Virginia
lenders.occupational_info: I study molecules and their reactions.

lenders.name: Jantique
lenders.loan_because: Hillel wrote, "If I am not for myself, who will be for me? If I am only for myself, what am I? And if not now, when?"  Moses Maimonaides said that the highest form of charity is to Prevent Poverty.
lenders.occupational_info: My passion is writing--and reading--fiction.  Picture of Merry and Rodney, the pussycats.

lenders.name: 2007 Pryor Legacy Class
lenders.loan_because:
We are twenty-nine college students in the Pryor Leadership Program at William Jewell College.  In 2007, we decided to help entrepreneurs around the world with microloans.  Partnering with Kiva, we developed a semester-long fundraising and awareness campaign.  The money raised has reached and will continue to reach entrepreneurs for years to come.  Their success is the lasting legacy of our project.

A special thanks to everyone who supported the project.  Without their help, we would not have reached our goals.  This is as much their legacy as it is ours.
lenders.occupational_info:
The Pryor Leadership Studies Program is internationally-recognized and one of the top leadership programs in the nation.  The Pryor program is a 3-year program which complements any major and prepares students to be leaders in their workplace and community.  The last stage in the Pryor program is a semester long Legacy Project that contributes to the local, regional, or international community.

William Jewell College is a campus of achievement that promises to offer students an outstanding liberal arts education with a focus on cultivating leadership, service and spiritual growth within a community inspired by rigorous intellectual challenges and Christian ideals.

lenders.name: James
lenders.loan_because: we're all connected and meant to share the good things God has brought our way.
lenders.occupational_info: Advertising and marketing for a variety of clients.  The name of our agency is tango, named after our dog that we found on the streets of Buenos Aires.

lenders.name: Carol
lenders.occupation: Facilitator of The Work of Byron Katie
lenders.loan_because: I know how hard it is to start a business with no support; I have done it a few times.
lenders.occupational_info: Using a powerful self-inquiry process, I help people question the stressful beliefs that hold them back and cause suffering.

lenders.name: David
lenders.loan_because: It's the right thing to do. My business has been down the last few years, but I will loan whenever and whatever I can.

lenders.name: Lusi
lenders.occupational_info: I help people make their businesses better

lenders.name: Ken
lenders.loan_because: want people to have a chance at realizing their goal of establishing and running a successful business

lenders.name: Adam
lenders.loan_because: We need to help each other.  It's that simple.

lenders.name: Linda
lenders.loan_because: it's the right thing to do.

lenders.name: Sean
lenders.loan_because: Gifting is reciprocal.
lenders.occupational_info: Assisting students realize their potential as a lifelong learner and joyful member of our world community.

lenders.name: Matt & Sarah
lenders.loan_because: To love our neighbor is to love God.

lenders.name: Zac Cramer
lenders.loan_because: My grandfather died and left me a lot of money, I decided to give a portion of it away. He started many small businesses throughout his life, so I know he would be thrilled to help other people with their dreams.
lenders.occupational_info: I run a Portland computer repair company, Happy Hamster Computer Repair.

lenders.name: Karen
lenders.loan_because: I would like to assist in improving the economic condition of people in disadvantaged areas.  I greatly admire Mother Teresa who helped the poorest of the poor.  Although we can't walk in her footsteps, we want to help all we can.
lenders.occupational_info: Karen is a State police officer who works special investigations.

lenders.name: lawrence
lenders.loan_because:
it is the right thing to do
i can
i should
i will
lenders.occupational_info:
i work in the operating room
i save lives when they are hurt
i should save lives before they are hurt

lenders.name: Miranda
lenders.loan_because: I want to support independent, female-owned businesses in the developing world.
lenders.occupational_info: I am earning a graduate degree in creative writing at New York University.  I also work parttime as a teacher and editor.

lenders.name: leonard
lenders.loan_because:
it seems like a wonderful idea
to give people a start in life
lenders.occupational_info: i am retired

lenders.name: Zyan & Zephaan mom
lenders.loan_because: We are all together in the circle of life.
lenders.occupational_info: I develop computer softwares for Energy and Healthcare industries.

lenders.name: Pio & Cherry
lenders.loan_because: it's a small way of helping empower    others.

lenders.name: harman
lenders.loan_because: We are called to help others help themselves.
lenders.occupational_info: community builder

lenders.name: William
lenders.loan_because: it was better than my idea

lenders.name: Jean
lenders.loan_because: I can make a difference
lenders.occupational_info: I work for the State of New Jersey regulating insurance companies.

lenders.name: Kathryn
lenders.loan_because: I like the idea that I can make small loans that can be a part of a large difference.

lenders.name: James
lenders.loan_because: I believe in the human spirit.  I hope to make the world a better place.
lenders.occupational_info:
I have studied how money works at college.  Accountants help business owners by giving them with information about how their business works.  They take the information on sales and expenses and can tell business owners how they are doing and what can be done to make more money.  Accountants also study some buiness law and contracts.
I worked as a bookkeeper for small businesses during my college studies, so I am very good at knowing how to run small businesses.  I can provide expert advice beyond simply loaning money, if such advice is asked for.

lenders.name: Zachary
lenders.loan_because: Microfinancing is an effective way to empower small business owners without simply handing them charity.
lenders.occupational_info: I am a student interested in photography, political science and Africa.  Hopefully I will find a way to combine them all.

lenders.name: Joanne
lenders.loan_because: It is an excellent way to help people realize their dreams but still be responsible for their choices. Kiva provides opportunity which might not otherwise exist and I fully support the concept of self-actualization.
lenders.occupational_info: Retired law enforcement.

lenders.name: Kate & Owen
lenders.loan_because: We want to help people who need help.
lenders.occupational_info: I write and edit educational books. My son is in college.

lenders.name: C.Scott
lenders.loan_because: Africa is the most amazing place.  Its people are among the most hard working and helpful I have ever met.  I am pleased to be assisting those who seek to help themselves and their community.  Bahati Njema!
lenders.occupational_info: I consult to government agencies and medium to small businesses in setting up their information systems.

lenders.name: Lisa
lenders.loan_because: this makes so much sense.
lenders.occupational_info: I create computer-based courses for businesses to use in training their employees.

lenders.name: Tyler
lenders.loan_because: I loan because I have the opportunity to do so.  The well being of people all over the world is important me.  Where macro economics have failed I have faith that micro economics will succeed.  I am using my documentary film THE HILLS OF CARACAS to raise funds for this cause.
lenders.occupational_info: I fight wild land fires in the summer.  When there are no fires in the winter I produce educational films.

lenders.name: Bernice
lenders.loan_because: I want people to have a chance to make a living and raise their children.
lenders.occupational_info: I work in a Red Cross blood donation center.

lenders.name: basya
lenders.loan_because: the world is made better one life, one day at a time.
lenders.occupational_info: I work in a clinic for people with developmental disabilities.  I help link people to resources they are eligible for and can benefit from.

lenders.name: Laura
lenders.loan_because: I know what it's like to need help.
lenders.occupational_info: I'm a visual artist, working with collage and assemblage to create pieces of work that deal with subjects including the effects of war on humanity, the relationship of humans to nature, mythology, and anything else that comes into my head.

lenders.name: Lorna
lenders.loan_because: I know every dollar will get to a borrower who will use it far more productively than I ever could.

lenders.name: David
lenders.loan_because: I would like to give people who are not forutnate enough to live in a country where there are as many opportunites as mine a chance to succeed and raise themselves out of poverty
lenders.occupational_info: I work on economic and energy related consulting projects.

lenders.name: Marley
lenders.loan_because:
I love that microlending offers credit opportunities to some of the people who most need it. And now Kiva lets me feel even more a part of this world-changing process.
   I'm pleased that my contributions here will not dissipate but accumulate.This is my idea of a meaningful portfolio.

lenders.name: Ben & Susan
lenders.loan_because: It's a small and simple act to try and be of some help.

lenders.name: Bill
lenders.loan_because: I have spent many years trying to find investors in my ideas and have them tell me reasons why I shouldn't receive funding.  It feels good to be on the other side and say yes to funding requests.
lenders.occupational_info: I have a website business that tries to help young entrepreneurs find mentors and build skills to become successful in their careers.

lenders.name: Peter
lenders.loan_because: I was given opportunities that other people should have, too.

lenders.name: Rebecca & Warren
lenders.occupational_info:

W-is a professor who researches addictions

lenders.name: Tristram
lenders.loan_because: Everyone deserves fair access to capital.

lenders.name: Dwight
lenders.loan_because: Micro-loans are an effective way to spead God's grace in the world.
lenders.occupational_info: I plan public transportation services in a community of 100,000 people.

lenders.name: Sophia
lenders.loan_because: I want to help, regardless of color and religion.
lenders.occupational_info: I write music for film and TV.

lenders.name: James
lenders.loan_because: I can.  I enjoy using my wealth to assist others and these micro-loans seem to be a great way to do it.
lenders.occupational_info: I manage software developers around the world for a large technology company.

lenders.name: Jane
lenders.loan_because: microcredit to small business people is a great way to help others.
lenders.occupational_info: I work with students in high school and help them with their studies.

lenders.name: susan
lenders.loan_because: It is a positive way to fight poverty
lenders.occupational_info: Writing and publishing (personal essays)and technical editing for a non-profit working to improve nutrition in developing countries.  Former dairy farmer

lenders.name: Amy L Clark
lenders.loan_because: Small businesses are essential for empowering communities, helping individuals lift themselves out of poverty, and fighting the control of multinational corporations which are interested in profit at the expense of humanity and morality.
lenders.occupational_info: I teach writing and critical thinking skills to all kinds of people.  I also write stories.

lenders.name: L A
lenders.loan_because: I can.
lenders.occupational_info: Reflecting on the universe and my place in it.

lenders.name: Carla
lenders.loan_because: It's such a painless way to make such a huge difference in another person's life.
lenders.occupational_info: I am retired, but am currently writing historical novels loosely based on my Cherokee ancestors.

lenders.name: Michael
lenders.loan_because: with this small gesture I can improve the lives of others in a real and measurable way.

lenders.name: Espy
lenders.loan_because: I don't have a lot of cash to donate, but lending small amounts can do tremendous good.
lenders.occupational_info: Well, I stand up and try to tell jokes to make people laugh. But, I do have a "day job" where I earn my living. This involves health care administration in a very large city.

lenders.name: Mariel
lenders.loan_because: There have been times in our family's life when we have been blessed by the kindness of strangers.  Kiva offers a wonderful opportunity for me to give someone a helping hand.
lenders.occupational_info: While being a wife and mom to 4 sons,  I went to college for 4 years, then taught students ages 13-15. I recently retired from teaching and now enjoy volunteer work, swimming and reading.

lenders.name: Gini
lenders.loan_because: It seems like an efficient and effective way to make a difference.
lenders.occupational_info: I teach ethics, law, and public policy to veterinary students and consult to media companies about animal issues.

lenders.name: Helen
lenders.loan_because: I believe a hand up is better than a hand out.  Good luck to all the new entrepreneurs

lenders.name: Stephen
lenders.loan_because: It's direct. It's powerful. It's the right thing to do.
lenders.occupational_info: I interpret natural and human-created environments through a camera lens to create images that communicate my sense of wonder at the variety and beauty of the world around us.

lenders.name: Janine & Gregg
lenders.loan_because: We want to help people in other parts of the world build their own bright futures.
lenders.occupational_info: We run a small software development company in the Pacific Northwest of the US.

lenders.name: Jon Peterson
lenders.loan_because: I know what it's like to have an idea but no money to get started.
lenders.occupational_info: Painter

lenders.name: Los Que Dan
lenders.loan_because: We loan because we can.  The only way to make a difference in this world is to try, and if it's possible to make the lives of others better in the process then it's worth it.
lenders.occupational_info: We're a Social 10 class at the Lethbridge Collegiate Institute in Alberta. We attend school full-time and are active participants in our community.

lenders.name: Lora Jean
lenders.loan_because: I can.

lenders.name: Mary
lenders.loan_because: I should.

lenders.occupational_info: I work with businesses to help them find ways to become more efficient and effective in their business processes.

lenders.name: Rockroom Wine
lenders.loan_because: eliminating poverty around the globe is an idea whose time has come; businesses like these will make it happen.
lenders.occupational_info: I started Rockroom Winemaking Cooperative where we make and share some great wine...and use the profits to fund loans!  When I am not making wine I work with entrepreneurs using creative business approaches and technologies to build amazing new businesses.

lenders.name: Sue
lenders.loan_because: I can and because it feels hopeful to provide someone else with a chance at bettering his/her circumstances in life.
lenders.occupational_info: I manage information systems -- to help make people do their jobs more easily.

lenders.name: Claire
lenders.occupational_info: I research how companies treat their employees, the communities where they're located, the people that consumer their products, and the environment.  I write summaries of a company's actions and rate how responsible it is.  Then my firm sells that information to investors who only want to invest in responsible companies that treat the world well.

lenders.name: David
lenders.loan_because: When we invest in each other, we invest in our collective future.

lenders.name: Josh & Marcy
lenders.loan_because: Action is better than inaction
lenders.occupational_info: I work to protect the legislative interests of members of the union.

lenders.name: rico
lenders.loan_because:
"If you want others to be happy, practice compassion. If you want to be happy, practice compassion."
-His Holiness the Dalai Lama.
These loans are made in memory of Kelsang Namtso.
lenders.occupational_info: Retired.

lenders.name: Suzanne
lenders.loan_because: I believe most people only want a chance to do something to make a difference in their own lives and for their families.

lenders.name: D. Skip
lenders.loan_because: We are all in this world together. Let's do our best to make it a better place for all of us.

lenders.name: Christy
lenders.loan_because: I want people to have the opportunity to improve the livelihood of their families and communities. I've seen what a difference these loans can make for entrepreneurs, and I appreciate the opportunity to help.

lenders.name: Michael and Kim
lenders.loan_because: .... we have been so blessed with opportunities.   If we can help others to make their lives better through their own efforts, it helps repay the world for the wonders we enjoy.

lenders.name: Ben
lenders.loan_because: microloans make it possible for a regular American like me to have a direct impact on poverty around the world.
lenders.occupational_info: I manage internet businesses and projects.

lenders.name: Trent
lenders.loan_because: I believe this is an excellent way of providing aide to humans while maintaining each individual's dignity and ability to be liberated from some difficult circumstances.
lenders.occupational_info: I am a high school teacher and assistant principal.

lenders.name: Emily
lenders.occupational_info: I research water and sanitation in urban India.

lenders.name: Masa
lenders.loan_because: it is potentially long term help, whereas charity is one-time help.

lenders.name: Mojo Mom
lenders.loan_because: We can't count on governments to solve all the problems.  Ordinary people have to reach out and help each other as we can!
lenders.occupational_info: I help mothers discover their own sense of personal power and leadership, including an entrepreneurial spirit.

lenders.name: Ben
lenders.loan_because: I believe there is value in helping others.
lenders.occupational_info: I proofread articles, take photographs and design newspaper pages for a local newspaper in eastern North Carolina, USA.

lenders.name: Terry
lenders.loan_because: I can.
lenders.occupational_info: As a former business coach, I helped people get into  a business that matches up with their goals and needs through a unique discovery process.  Many of my clients found a business they never would have found or considered except for working through me.  Needless to say, I love my work.

lenders.name: Rachel
lenders.loan_because: it is a brilliant way to help redistribute global resources more justly

lenders.name: John
lenders.loan_because: I believe the world will be a better place when people can touch other people on a personal level.  This is a powerful use of the internet.
lenders.occupational_info: I teach philosophy and world religions to university students in the US, Mexico, and Japan.

lenders.name: Michael
lenders.loan_because: I would like to help these small entrepreneurs succeed and help build their neighborhoods, cities, and countries.
lenders.occupational_info: I set up SAP Software Solutions for government agency's and large corporations.

lenders.name: Rick
lenders.loan_because: I have a responsibility to share my good fortune to help others throughout the world to grow and prosper.  I also want it known that there are Americans who care about them and their growth.
lenders.occupational_info: I teach young scientists.

lenders.name: Allyson
lenders.loan_because: "We could have saved the Earth but we were too damned cheap."  -Kurt Vonnegut
lenders.occupational_info: Write documents to help business employees

lenders.name: Diana
lenders.loan_because: Leverage! What makes a small difference in my life can make a big difference in someone else's life.
lenders.occupational_info: Mt company works with non-profits to measure how they change the knowledge, attitudes and behavior of the people they serve: assessing impact.

lenders.name: Rachel
lenders.loan_because: I believe in the power of microcredit and I want to do my part to help people succeed with their businesses.

lenders.name: Nicholas
lenders.loan_because: I want the world to know that Americans aren't as bad as the current regime in Washington, and believe that entrepreneurship leads to self sufficiency, self sufficiency leads to stability, stability leads to peace
lenders.occupational_info: I have been writing scripts for television shows, but am now starting my own book publishing company in India.

lenders.name: Leonore
lenders.loan_because: Though middle class by American standards, my family is very privileged according to world standards.
lenders.occupational_info: I teach 10th grade World History and Geography.

lenders.name: Allan
lenders.loan_because: I can....Also, my father taught me to help out our neighbors whenever possible
lenders.occupational_info: I am a former photojournalist, who has seen a bit of the world. Right now I am teaching part time (photography and Spanish)

lenders.name: Tony & Phyllis
lenders.loan_because: The Dalai Lama says that the secret to happiness is to alleviate the suffering of others.
lenders.occupational_info: Phyllis sells BMW's at a competitive, mostly male dealer. Tony manages stock portfolios for investors. Kiva helps us remember how lucky we are.

lenders.name: Tiffany
lenders.loan_because: it is an easy way to help change someone else's life

lenders.name: Scott
lenders.loan_because: People need help.
lenders.occupational_info: I go to Moorpark College and I am currently studying to become a Narrator

lenders.name: Mazzy and Rivers
lenders.loan_because: It's so easy to make a positive difference in someone's life.

lenders.name: Alice18
lenders.loan_because: I have so much in life, and I want to share.
lenders.occupational_info: I teach nutrition to college students, including some who will become dietitians.  I used to counsel people with nutrition problems like diabetes and hypertension about how to eat.

lenders.name: Lesli
lenders.loan_because: I read the article in today's New York Times and I was inspired! Thank you Nicholas Kristof for bringing this terrific program to my attention.

lenders.name: Adam S.
lenders.occupational_info: University student studying mathematics

lenders.name: Loris
lenders.loan_because: I care and I can. I strive to do my best and I know I have been blessed with everything (and more)  I need. It's sad that it's 2010 and innocent people still die of hunger and war.  Join me in enpowering them to true freedom with work and education.
lenders.occupational_info: Software Guru

lenders.name: Violet
lenders.loan_because: I think this is a wonderful idea and I feel I'm doing something very positive.
lenders.occupational_info: I take care of people who have asthma and other lung diseases.

lenders.name: Frederick
lenders.loan_because: Everyone should have opportunities. I want to share my good fortune.
lenders.occupational_info: High tech geek

lenders.name: Andrea
lenders.loan_because: this is how WE will make a difference in the world.....

lenders.name: Don
lenders.loan_because: I am interested in finding ways to help people with fewer advantages than I and my family have toward a better life.  The Kiva loan program seems like one good way to do this.
lenders.occupational_info: I am retired. My job before retirement was as a consultant, helping companies and government agencies improve their health care insurance programs.

lenders.name: Beverly
lenders.loan_because: Kiva is a songline that traces its dreaming over the world, how can we not travel on this journey.
lenders.occupational_info: Office Worker:  Computor work, phone answerer...all around general office work.  The person behind the scenes that keeps the copier and every thing else running.

lenders.name: Patrick
lenders.loan_because: I can.
lenders.occupational_info: I tell stories.
